name: Binary Tree Traversal
explanation: Tree traversal visits all nodes in a specific order. In-order (Left-Node-Right) visits nodes in sorted order for BSTs. Pre-order (Node-Left-Right) visits root first, useful for copying trees. Post-order (Left-Right-Node) visits root last, useful for deletion. All have O(n) time complexity. Trees are fundamental data structures for hierarchical data, file systems, and expression parsing.

examples.problem: Traverse tree with root=5, left=3, right=7. What is in-order traversal?
